abstract: This review on the dengue vaccine pipeline was a solicited article and drafted based on the pre-defined template for PD-VAC.

author_highlights.sentence: Dengue represents a significant public health and economic burden globally.
Dengue vaccine candidates are designed primarily for use in endemic settings, which are predominantly low and middle income countries.
The first dengue vaccine has been licensed, with several candidates in the clinical pipeline.
A vaccine protecting children younger than 9 years of age will be a useful addition.
Cost of, and funding for, vaccination will be a key factor in country's ability to introduce dengue vaccines.
